file_content.text: Welcome to Alderaan, hunter. Former tourist capital of the Core Worlds.
Your target here's a nobleman nicknamed "The Durasteel Duke," on account of his knack for stayin' alive.
Over a thousand assassins have come and gone tryin' to put the duke to bed, but he ain't met you yet, right?
He was last seen with House Girard, they're guests of House Thul, so that's a good place to start looking. Good luck.
Figures she'd gloss over the details. Lucky for you, I'm on the job.
Fill me in. I hate surprises.
Go on.
Yeah, lucky for me....
Boring.
Oh come on, I promise I'll use tiny words.
In a nutshell, when the queen of Alderaan died a few years ago, the head of the military declared himself king.
That didn't go over so well, now the three largest houses are fighting over the crown.
I'll need to know more about the major players.
Who are the large houses?
Well, General Bouris Ulgo is the guy who declared himself king, and his house controls most of Alderaan's former military.
Who would have seen that coming?
Seems pretty straightforward.
A lot of people didn't. Bouris Ulgo was a Republic war hero.
House Organa and House Thul are Ulgo's only real opposition, but they're at each other's throats too.
Basically, Organa wants Alderaan back in the Republic, and Thul came back from exile with the help of the Empire--hey, you getting all this?
Our mark is with Girard at House Thul and the rest are target practice. Anything else?
I got enough.
That pretty much sums it up.
Yeah, very nice job. Thorough.
Sorry, just impressed.
This is kinda old news. I had plenty of time to read up on the trip here.
Honestly, figured you'd be awhile. Thought I'd catch a nap.
Huh? I drifted off.
Glad you're taking things seriously.
Uh-huh, keep it up and I'm going to toss that helmet out the air lock.
Let's see which one wants it badly enough.
I smell credits.
While I applaud your ambition, you could work your magic on Alderaan for fifty years and never weed out every would-be usurper.
Still, you should make a killing while you're here.
I'm all for making extra credits, just don't forget about the Great Hunt.
All I need to know is how far I have to walk before I bury the Durasteel Duke.
Skip the details.
Fine, it's not like I spent hours studying all this stuff.
Come on, we'd better go pay a visit to House Girard. Oh--one last thing.
The nobles of Alderaan are different. They think they're untouchable, and they won't be impressed--no matter how big a gun you wave around.
I've always heard how beautiful Alderaan's supposed to be. Figures I'm going to see it in the middle of a war.
In light of Mako's wounded expectations, I'd be happy to accompany you in her stead.
There's a lot of "old money" on Alderaan that could be a lot of "our money" if we play our cards right.
I'll keep that in mind. Mako, start the briefing.
Noted.
I take it you've been here before.
You know your way around?
Oh, I've dropped a couple dozen aliases here and there.
You mean "my money." You're still working to pay off that second chance I gave you.
What's this "our" business?
As long as I'm not helping out of the kindness of my heart. I have morals to uphold.
In any case, let's have your little friend here brush us up on current events.
As if I needed you around to tell me to do my job.
Ignore him. We've got work to do.
Keep your head in the game.
You're right. Sorry, boss.
He just knows that we'd be helpless without your intel.
Take it easy, Mako.
Oh, I bet.
I don't see you doing it. Get to work.
Now I'm telling you.
That's because I'm already finished, boss.
Let's just see what Crysta's got to say, and I'll fill in the gaps.
At least it'll still be pretty in the holos.
You can sightsee after we win the Great Hunt.
We're here on business anyway.
That's assuming there'll be anything left to see. Forget it, you wouldn't understand.
Don't sweat it; when we win the Great Hunt, I'm taking you on vacation.
Hey, chin up.
Really? You mean that?
We'll work out the particulars as soon as the job's done.
Business before pleasure.
I'm holding you to that.
Name the place and we're there.
Of course.
Thanks, big guy, that means a lot.
Not if you keep acting so shocked whenever I say something nice.
I'm having second thoughts.
No, sorry, you just surprised me.
We should pick up Juda, make it a thing. I bet she'd love to get away from Nem'ro for awhile.
If that's what you want.
Doesn't matter to me.
Then it's settled. I think it'll be fun.
Definitely. That girl really needs to get out more.
Juda could use a break.
You're telling me, but she does play a mean hand of sabacc.
What's she done to deserve a vacation other than almost get herself killed?
Juda hasn't earned it.
I don't see her ducking blaster fire to win the Great Hunt, why's she need a vacation?
No risk, no reward.
I just thought she'd be fun to have around. It's your party.
We could use some R & R, that's for sure.
Time to find out who's standing between us and a week on the beach.
Bloodshed's an art. Alderaan'll make a fine canvas.
It'll be pretty painted red.
I know you love what you do, but get your head checked. Seriously.
Let's just watch the holo and find out who your target is.
